column4: My install of ubuntu worked fine but when I boot my computer I get Grub Error 17. I've entered a linux environment and has mounted my linux partition so I can read fstab and /grub/menu.lst but I have no idea what the error is
Can someone help me solve Grub Error 17?
google maybe
what did you do before error 17 came up?
Installed ubuntu from a USB stick
so it hasnt been working before...hmm ok
Exactly. I'm guessing there is some error in either fstab or menu.lst, but I'm not skilled enough to see what the problem is
or just in the grub config, right...
on bootup...you can press ESC key to make grub halt for input....you can edit entries with the 'e' key....verify the settings....google if you dont understand each..or ask here again....
another nice tool might be supergrub
but i guess you are new to linux and the really most important thing to learn at the beggining is: learn to read, learn and understand. sounds common, but its really essential with linux
Actually, I've used Linux for several years :/ Never had Ubuntus autoinstall of grub fail on me though
ok :)
so why not learn grub :)
To be honest, I'm just not all that comfortable playing around the booting etc. I'm so used to it just working and I really don't want to risk anything
the risk to do sth. wrong it there, if you dont read and understand...
someone here could tell you to user \rm -rf /& to fix it.....and then?
but take a look at http://www.supergrubdisk.org/
Well, I'm not stupid :) I wouldn't just input anything someone told me without checking out what their instructions meant
then try the supergrub linke i gave you before
I guess I can try putting supergrub on my USB and see if it helps
you need to use it from a bootable device...but just read ;)
I know, I installed linux from the USB stick so
